subtitles.dialogue_text: Tokuma Shoten, Japan Αirlines, Nippon Television Network and Studio Ghibli Present
Porco Rosso! The Mamma Aiutos are on the move.
The Mamma Αiutos? I don't work cheap, you know.
They're after a mine's payroll out of Venice.
There's a school tour group aboard.
There's 15 of them. Do we take them all?
They took the girls and the money.
I know what those cheapskates are up to.
They'll change course for the nearest island as soon as they're out of sight.
What, it's just a tour group.
Hey, it's a pig. A pig!
Be careful or the pirates will get you.
You're the one who said to bring them all.
Just for a second. I'm not supposed to let you.
That's as far as you go.
What are you doing? Shoot him down!
Message from the pig. "You're beat. Do what I say."
We crashed. We're going to sink!
No we won't. This is a seaplane.
Don't worry. We're on the swim team.
"You can keep half the money. Give me the rest and the kids."
Shut up! Come on, you swine. It's you and me!
He left us money for repairs.
Don't pull on that, you'll break it.
Got to pee? Do it over there.
So the Mamma Αiutos can't come tonight.
And that filthy pig of a bounty hunter is a hero.
But this young kid's an American, right?
The air pirates of the Adriatic, asking a Yankee for help!
And he'll finish Porco for us.
But ten per cent is outrageous.
With his snout in the air, as always.
Mr. Porco Rosso? I'm from The Neptune.
We hear you put the Mamma Αiutos out of action.
Do you think that will affect this year's bounties?
Even American pilots know Madame Gina of the Hotel Adriano.
That's why we all leave our quarrels outside.
Is that your Curtiss out front?
The Rattlesnake. Winner of fame and fortune.
You took the Schneider Cup two years running.
She's unbeatable in a dogfight, too.
But I hear there's this Porco Rosso who's pretty famous, too.
Better watch your back with those pirates, kid.
They're poor, cheap, and dirty. They could use a bath.
Quite a distinguished gathering! You boys must be planning something.
Always glad to see you, but no war games here, okay?
We know, Gina. We never work within 50 kilometers of here.
We're even nice to the pig.
Porco, tell us a war story.
He took one look and said marry me.
I told him I'd lost three pilot husbands already.
One in combat, one in the Atlantic. The third died in Asia.
I got a call today. They found the wreckage in Bengal.
I waited three years. I've got no tears left.
The good always get killed. To comrades.
Thanks, Marco. You're always here for me.
You're the only one left from the old days.
One thing I don't like about this place...
Don't touch it. It's the only one of you when you were human.
I wish I could release you from that spell.
That Yank knows how to fly.
Must be nice to make that much money.
How about helping the people out with a Patriot Bond?
Do I look like a person?
All ready for you, Mr. Porco Rosso.
Υeah? Maybe the government's going to change again.
They'll pass a law against you guys.
That's for sure. Or moles like me.
Just regular ammo? No high-explosive or armor-piercing?
We're not fighting a war out there, kid.
Hey, Boss. How is war different from bounty hunting?
War profiteers are villains. Bounty hunters are just stupid.
We're air pirates. We don't borrow from banks.
Why do we have to fly with that bunch of losers?
Can't those Mamma Αiutos even afford paint?
Hey, is the American here yet?
We're taking a ship that big?
That's why we all got together.
Having engine trouble. Go first. We'll cover you.
That's a dirty trick! We follow the plan.
You gutless wonder! We pay our own repairs, just like always.
Attention! We are under attack by air pirates.
There is no need for alarm.
We carry two advanced fighter aircraft.
We will now introduce our pilots.
And the Wolf of the Tiber, Signor Visconti.
- They brought muscle! - That wasn't in the deal!
Guess I have to go to Milan.
Both pilots were shot down, but parachuted to safety.
The Pirate Federation looted the vessel and left this message.
You're next. Come and get us, pig.
Just get me to Milan, little engine.
I don't like this weather. I'll have to fly low.
Come on, you can do it!
No you didn't. My engine quit.
Yes! Now I'll be famous too. Yahoo!
I can't go back empty-handed. They won't believe me without proof.
That stupid red color. No mistake.
A souvenir for my mama in Alabama.
There's a phone call. He's safe. He's alive.
Use the phone at the front desk.
Marco? Are you all right? I was just leaving to look for you.
I've lost weight. Two nights on a deserted island.
I'm taking the plane to Milan for repairs.
If the Yank comes in, tell him I'll see him again.
I worry about you pilots, but you treat me like the furniture.
Marco, you'll end up roasted. I won't go to your funeral.
I figured you'd show up tonight.
Why not just get a new plane?
Look out. I'll back her in.
My granddaughter, back from the States.
What a beautiful plane, Grandpa! It's got great lines.
They don't make them like that anymore.
I'm going up against Curtiss. I need another 15 knots.
Curtiss? I haven't heard that name for a while.
Where did you get a Folgore?
The plane Curtiss beat in 1927 for the Schneider Cup had this engine.
But it wasn't the engine's fault. The mechanic was a fool.
Don't over-tune her. It's not a race.
Tell me about it! You're preaching to the converted.
These days money's not worth the paper it's printed on.
Empty your pockets. That's for the propeller, the paint...
Stay here. I'll put you up cheap.
Where are your sons? Are they good?
She's young, but she's got something my sons don't.
I've known you a long time, but I think I'll try somewhere else.
It is because I'm a girl? Or because I'm young?
Tell me, what's the main thing a good pilot needs?
I'm glad you didn't say experience.
Grandpa says you were very young when you first soloed.
You were good from the start.
I can't help being a girl, but we've got your old blueprints.
If it's no good, you don't have to pay. Okay, Grandpa?
I was overhauling engines when I was 12.
Shower's hot. Towels on the rack. Breakfast at 7. Good night.
You're short, but we're friends. I'll loan you the rest.
Same wing plan with a different cross section.
That should give us five knots.
The original plans are amazing. The old wings were monocoque.
I've never seen anything like it.
Whoever designed this wing really understood wood.
They only built one. They said it was too dangerous to fly.
With this wing sweep, I'm surprised you even get lift.
Takeoffs and landings are tricky. No one can touch her in the air.
Sweep the wings half a degree more.
So you'll let me do it? Thank you! You won't be sorry.
Don't work all night. You need sleep to do good work.
Actually, I was so nervous last night I couldn't sleep.
To tell the truth, I was afraid you wouldn't let me do it.
I'm so happy! I'll make some coffee.
I hope she's not going to build it herself too.
My niece Monica will do the drawings, my nephew's wife the finishing...
My cousin's daughters, Sophia, Laura, Constance and Valentina.
Fio's sister Giliola. Sandra's her cousin. Marietta, you've gotten so pretty.
My sons' wives Maria, Tina, Anna, and her sister Miletta.
The angels haven't come for you yet?
You've grown into a fine man!
To buy things for our great grandchildren.
Υeah. There's no work here. The men are all away working.
Don't worry. The women are tough and they work hard.
Our Lord who art in Heaven...
We thank Thee for giving our struggling company work and bread.
Forgive our using women's hands to build a fighter plane.
Let's eat up and get to work!
How do you like them RPMs?
Watch out or you'll blow the shed away.
Well, this is going to cost a lot more money.
We're way over budget already. Ask our sponsor.
Don't look at me like that. Do whatever you like.
Great! I'll tell the workshop and we'll get to work.
That's the furthest thing from my mind.
I go where I want, Ferrarin.
The authorities don't like it. Did you notice you're being tailed?
There are warrants out on you for treason, illegal entry, decadence...
They want to seize your plane, too.
Come back to the Air Force, Marco. I could still get you in.
Better a pig than a Fascist.
To fly now you need a government or an airline to pay you.
Wherever you fly, you're still a pig.
Thanks, Ferrarin. Say hello to the guys.
Watch your back. They won't bother with a trial.
I borrowed this to take the plane to the lake for tests tomorrow.
No tests. I've got no time.
Don't be stupid! I won't deliver an untested plane.
We can take it apart and get it to the lake in a day.
I said there's no time. Take a look behind us.
Because they're following me. And you're fixing my plane.
I don't work hard enough to be a spy.
But you were a war hero.
Doesn't seem like you've been doing nothing.
There's two men out back and three in front.
I'm coming with you. Give me five minutes.
What are you talking about? Don't be stupid!
You're a respectable woman. And you're not married.
Look, I'm a bounty hunter. I'm not running a tourist service.
I want to get my first job right. I can make adjustments as we go.
I'm taking off from the canal. I might not even get airborne.
All the more reason to take me. You'll need a mechanic against Curtiss.
I'm a man. We'll be all alone on a deserted island.
Take her along. If you don't beat Curtiss, we don't get paid.
If you don't pay, we go broke.
I'll give you a break on her salary and throw in this voice tube.
They'll put a price on her head.
We'll tell the police you forced us to help you. That'll be our excuse.
Please take me with you. I'll make myself useful.
Take out the right machine gun.
I don't care how small your bottom is, that's a tight fit.
Okay! My hips are bigger than they look. Wait a minute.
We better leave before Grandma decides to come too.
A handful, just like you. I can barely control it.
No time. I've got to get her up.
The flaps are in the water. Use your tabs.
Beautiful. The world is so beautiful.
But that's an Air Force plane.
The Air Force is waiting for us. He'll show us a way through.
He says to fly low to the Adriatic.
He saw you and signaled "pearls before swine."
A single rose blooming in a secret garden.
Naughty boy. This is a private garden.
"Regarding your starring in the movie script you sent..."
I'm going to be a star, I'm sure of it.
The movie's called Flower of the Adriatic.
Gina, come to Hollywood with me.
Being a hired gun is just a rung on the ladder.
The next rung is Hollywood star.
I'm serious. I'll make you First Lady, Gina. I mean it.
You're a dreamer. I like that in a man.
But I can't go. I'm gambling right now.
Gambling someone will visit me here, and I'll tell him I love him.
But the fool only comes to the club at night.
He never comes out in daylight.
He kept going. I lost again.
You mean you're betting on that jerk?
Life here is more complicated than in your country.
I bumped my head when you did that roll.
Just saying hello to a friend.
The woman in white on the terrace? Grandpa told me.
All the pilots in the Adriatic are in love with Gina.
What's she like? Are you in love with her too?
I'm putting down. Shut up or you'll bite your tongue.
A girl in a fighter plane!
It's not just the caretaker government. It's the royalists, too.
They want to link up with the Pirates' Federation.
There's no money in chasing pirates any more.
All this talk about a depression!
You ought to sell your services somewhere, too.
A good pilot can make good money.
Curtiss'll go back to the States soon.
We're the ones who should go to America.
Farewell to days of fun and freedom in the Adriatic.
Their fuel costs three times more than in Italy.
We don't water our gas here. Girls are so stupid.
Then stuff your bigger-than-it-looks backside in the jump seat.
The fuel goes on your bill!
He wasn't gouging us. It's give and take.
It's pretty around here, but everyone's broke.
Agh! My butt's gone to sleep.
Look at this! He brought a girl!
Shut up! So what? Half the world is women.
That's not just any girl. She's Piccolo's chief designer.
My plane's a lot better than it was. She's young but she's good.
She's here to make sure I pay the bill.
You're in debt, too? Serves you right!
Bust that plane up so bad, all he's got left is the loan!
You're going to take an axe to the plane I built?
A plane as beautiful as that?
I was raised on stories about seaplane pilots.
My grandpa always said there's no finer people anywhere.
Their hearts are washed clean by the sea and sky.
That's right. That's us seaplane pilots!
The most precious thing to them isn't money or women, it's honor.
All right. We won't take our axes and bust up the plane you built.
But honor won't let us just walk away, either.
Υeah! Make hamburger out of him!
You don't understand! Haven't you any shame?
You need that American to save you?
Your mothers would weep. And tell you to take a bath!
Porco's come back to go one-on-one with Curtiss...
for the honor of the seaplane pilots of the Adriatic!
A man without honor or scruples is nothing. Fight fair!
I always said we shouldn't hire Curtiss.
We could lose face here. Should we talk to Curtiss?
Get him to fight the pig again?
I heard you! I don't run and I don't hide!
What idiot put a path up there?
So you want a return match?
But I already won once. I'm no one's hired gun now.
Will you marry me if I win?
All right. But if Porco wins, you pay his bills.
Speak now or hold your peace, Fio.
I'll gladly fight for the woman I love!
Listen, all of you! I like this girl's spirit.
The Mamma Αiutos will sponsor this fight!
Don't forget to show up, pig!
Shut up and get out of here!
Look what you've gone and gotten me into!
Don't be angry. I know it was stupid.
I've got to thank you anyway.
Thanks. I guess fate meant for us to be a team.
I hate that word, but it sounds different coming from you.
What's the matter? You're not feeling well?
My heart started beating so fast I couldn't breathe.
Go back to sleep. We're off early tomorrow.
Why did you turn into a pig?
My father was in the same unit with Lieutenant Marco Paggot.
I used to love the story of how he jumped off a cliff...
Like the princess who turned the frog back into a prince?
Don't be stupid. Save it for someone special.
You make me think humanity's not a complete waste.
Now be good and go to sleep.
Tell me a story, then I'll sleep.
It was the last summer of the war.
We were on our usual patrol over the Adriatic, heading for Istria.
An old friend, who'd gotten married two days before.
I was best man at his wedding.
But we couldn't get leave, so we'd come straight back to base.
Planes were dropping like flies, ours and theirs.
There were three on my tail.
Then I was the only one left on our side.
The enemy kept on coming. They had blood in their eyes.
I was numb, I couldn't see. I thought I was a goner.
Suddenly everything went white all around me.
Like I was in pure light.
But a light so strange I didn't notice I was in cloud.
I didn't even have the strength to hold the stick.
Υeah, and dead quiet. The sky was so beautiful...
with this one long contrail stretching out of sight.
Berlini, wait! Where are you going?
When I came to, I was all alone, flying just above the waves.
I think God was telling me to fly alone forever.
No, Porco! You're a good person!
The good ones are all dead. And maybe what I saw was Hell.
End of story. Go to sleep.
That junkyard sold me rusty ammo.
I'm glad you came back alive. I really like you, Porco.
If you're real men, put your money where your mouths are!
You'd think it was a carnival!
The scum of the Mediterranean. Gangsters, pirates, smugglers...
spies, undercover cops, and a few respectable citizens.
This is going to make me even more famous!
The showdown between Porco Rosso and Donald Curtiss is about to begin!
There's no rules. The first one to run is a coward forever!
Shut up! We came here for a dogfight, not speeches!
Shut up! Open your mouth and we shoot you!
A ten-ton bomb would be better.
This fight decides the fate of our beloved Miss Fio Piccolo...
Know what I mean? A big hand for Fio! Applaud!
Quiet! There are formalities to observe!
Both sides will place their wagers!
No complaints? All right, shake hands and come out flying!
Forget it. I'll keep my hands clean.
We'll go straight to the church!
Don't worry. My mother says you can get used to anything.
Black wins if it's over in three minutes!
Maybe we could get them to do this every month!
Come on, Porco! Get above him!
Don't worry! I've got lots of ammo.
A barrel roll. The pig's on his tail!
That trick made him the Ace of the Adriatic!
- He didn't shoot! - Did his gun jam?
He's not going to shoot until the very end.
The pig's not a killer. The American's still got plenty of ammo!
He didn't fire. What did I tell you?
If he shoots now, he'll hit the American.
He's going to wait till he can put two or three rounds into the engine.
The damn fool! This is no time for sportsmanship.
Or are your guns jammed? Too bad.
Come on, fight like a pig!
You only see this once in a lifetime!
If she doesn't hurry she'll miss it.
She won't come out of her room.
Are we going or not? I want to see it too!
Stop fooling around. Air Force is coming.
You think you can have Fio?
Now the pig's got his tail!
What's the matter, out of ammo?
This isn't a western! What are you going to hit with that?
What's that going to do? Hi-ho Silver!
Yes! The Federation can take bets.
Fio! Did you see that punch?
I'll finish you in the next round.
Who's it going to be, Fio or Gina?
The Air Force isn't here yet.
Trying to psyche me out, are you?
Are you going to break another woman's heart?
Okay, the party's over. The Italian Air Force is coming.
Come to the club. Drinks are on the house!
I hate the pig, but I like you. Build some good planes.
Next time it won't be a bet. I'll court you for real.
Sure. But I've made up my mind.
I ride in your plane! We're partners, aren't we?
Gina, take this girl back to the regular world.
You always do this. It's not fair.
I never saw Porco again, even after the Air Force gave up...
and I went back to Milan.
But Gina and I became good friends.
And we still are, through all the war and turmoil since then.
Now I run Piccolo Co., but I still summer at the Hotel Adriano.
Gina is more beautiful every year, and there are lots of old faces.
Oh, yes. Mr. Curtiss isn't President yet, but he writes us...
saying he misses the good old days of that Adriatic summer.
And did Gina win her bet? That's our secret.
PORCO ROSSO Shuichiro Moriyama MΑDΑME GINΑ Tokiko Kato
MΑSTER PICCOLO Sanshi Katsura MΑMMΑ ΑIUTO BOSS Tsunehiko Kamijo
Original Story and Screenplay by Hayao Miyazaki
English Translation by Stephen Alpert, Haruyo Moriyoshi
